name: Daniel Bruch
title: Senior Associate
bio: Daniel Bruch combines cutting-edge technical expertise with sophisticated legal knowledge to protect and enforce intellectual property rights for technology companies, inventors, and entrepreneurs. With degrees in electrical engineering and computer science from MIT and Carnegie Mellon, Daniel possesses the rare combination of deep technical understanding and legal acumen necessary to navigate complex intellectual property matters. As a registered Patent Attorney, he handles patent prosecution, trademark registration, and IP litigation for clients ranging from startups to Fortune 500 companies. Daniel's practice focuses on software patents, hardware innovations, and emerging technologies including artificial intelligence and blockchain. His technical background allows him to quickly grasp complex inventions and communicate effectively with both inventors and judges. He regularly advises clients on IP strategy, licensing agreements, and technology transfer matters.
